page.shortlink: api a5wcb create dialog using xbasic function

argument.name: wp
argument.description: A dot variable with an array called .page_fields[] that has an entry for each control you want to create.

argument.name: componentName
argument.description: The name of the component you want to create. The component will be created in the current Web Project.

argument.name: flagShowProgress
argument.description: (optional) A flag that indicates if a progress dialog should be displayed while the function is executing. Defaults to .T.

page.discussion: Create a dialog component programmatically.The properties that can be used for the wp.page_fields[] array are the same as those that are displayed when you edit a Dialog component in the Builder, and switch to the Xbasic tab. Typically, you will only need to set values for properties that are different from their default values.
page.example:
dim wp as p DIM wp.page_fields[0] as P with wp.page_fields[] .controltype = "layout_directive_statictext" .v.StaticText = "Created by Xdialog" end with
with wp.page_fields[] .controltype = "layout_directive_FrameBegin" .v.FrameTitle = "Name" .v.Frame.ID = "FRAME_1" .v.Frame.type = "Simple" end with
with wp.page_fields[] .v.variableName = "Firstname" .v.breakType = "None" end with
with wp.page_fields[] .v.variableName = "Lastname" .v.label = "Last Name" .v.hasWaterMark = .t. .v.waterMark.text = "Enter last name" end with
with wp.page_fields[] .controltype = "layout_directive_button" .v.buttonText = "Click Me" .v.javascript.onclick = "alert('click');" end with
with wp.page_fields[] .controltype = "layout_directive_hyperlink" .v.hyperlinkText = "Click here" .v.javascript.onclick = "alert('you clicked a hyperlink');" end with
with wp.page_fields[] .controltype = "layout_directive_image" .v.ImageMode = "Static" .v.javascript.onclick = "alert('click on image');" .v.Imagename = "images/$$application.alpha.png.a5image" end with
with wp.page_fields[] ' initialize tmpl.page_fields[9] .controltype = "dialog_formcontrol" .v.controlType = "DropdownBox" .v.variableName = "cities" .v.dropdownbox.size = 1 .v.dropdownbox.type = "Static" .v.dropdownbox.choices = <<%str% boston new york london%str% end with
with wp.page_fields[] .controltype = "layout_directive_FrameEnd" end with
a5wcb_createDialogUsingXbasic(wp,"Dialog1",.t.)

section.title: Building a Component Programmatically with Absolute Layout Containers
section.description: You can use the *[xb:a5wcb_createDialogUsingXbasic()]* Xbasic function to create a UX component that contains an Absolute Layout container. This is made possible because the Absolute Layout's *[xb:absolutePositions]* property allows you to specify the *[xb:variablename]* of the control in the absolute layout, rather than its *[xb:idInternal]* property, which cannot be used because it is dynamically assigned when *[xb:a5wcb_createDialogUsingXbasic()]* executes.
section.example:
dim wp as p DIM wp.page_fields[0] as P
with wp.page_fields[] .controltype = "layout_directive_ContainerBegin" .v.container.subType = "AbsoluteLayout" .v.container.id = "ABS1" .v.container.absolutePositions = <<%str% [ { variablename: 'c', top: '7px', left: '16px', height: '28px', width: '139px', style: 'position: absolute; top: 7px; left: 16px; width: 139px; height: 28px; ' }, { variablename: 'd', top: '156px', left: '141px', height: '27px', width: '132px', style: 'position: absolute; top: 156px; left: 141px; width: 132px; height: 27px; ' } ] %str% end with
with wp.page_fields[] .v.variableName = "c" .v.breakType = "None" end with
with wp.page_fields[] .v.variableName = "d" .v.label = "Field D" .v.hasWaterMark = .t. .v.waterMark.text = "Enter name" end with
with wp.page_fields[] .controltype = "layout_directive_Containerend" end with
a5wcb_createDialogUsingXbasic(wp,"genByXbasic",.t.)
